place.name: SOUTH SCARLE
place.gazetteerText: SCARLE (South), a township and a parish in Newark district, Notts. The township lies 1 mile W of Swinder-by r. station, and 7 N N E of Newark. Acres, 1, 540. Real property, £8, 818. Pop., 175. Houses, 43. The parish contains also the township of Besthorpe, with a post-office under Newark; and comprises 2,050 acres. Pop., 513. Houses, 108. The manor of Moreland, including all the parish and extending beyond it, is heldby the Duke of Newcastle under lease from the Crown. The living is a vicarage, with Besthorpe and Girton, in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £300.* Patron, the Bishop of Lincoln. The church is ancient. There are a chapel of ease, three dissenting chapels, a freeschool, and charities £19. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

unit.name: SOUTH SCARLE WITH BESTHORPE AND GIRTON
